I've been to Sochi twice for work. Back then they only had 2 branded hotels and I had to bribe the airport cop to board my plane (he took money after I told him he can't have my Blackberry). They also had 2 Radisson hotels...one was real, the other fake getting its supplies from the first one thanks to corruption.

Also, the guy who hired my company wanted to buy an adjacent site. So I met the owners (old couple who owned a small tennis club) who told me they're not selling. Came back a month later and our client told us he's now selling. So I wanted to meet that owner again to discuss how long it would take him to vacate the site. Only met his wife...because he was in rehab in hospital. "Someone" broke one of his legs and both arms...and he suffered internal bleeding.

The key question I have is: Who doesn't like to take a dump with a mate?

I don't want to put anyone in Russia down, but like most people, I think they screwed this one up. They have known about the 2014 games being in Sochi for at least four years now. You mean to tell me they couldn't even get basic infrastructure (such as clean water) in that time? They are still rushing to build hotels that should have opened no later than last Summer. Then there is their problem with strays. IMO, it seems a little brutal to send people out to shoot dogs (although I understand why they are doing it.) They couldn't have tried to catch and humanly euthanize them? Or maybe spay/ neuter, vaccinated and release them? I'm sure there are a lot of people around the world that would have donated money to sponsor that effort. Then there is the terrorism issue. The games are meant to be peaceful, yet the U.S. has a pair of warships in the Black Sea to extract U.S. athletes in the event of an attack. I honestly do not believe the RU's statement that they will be able to ensure security for the games.

I honestly do not think they are ready to host the games. Once again, this is not meant to be an attack on their inability to finish preparing, just a restatement of the facts.

I'm pretty sure we'll see an attack and, even worse, comrades doing a sh#tty job trying to mend the situation. Remember Beslan? They've sent their criminals on that school who just killed almost fu#king everyone, including the children, just to quickly stop everything. Stupid, evil, incompetent and brutal people were in charge.

I'd get the fu#k out of that country during the games. With huge security hauled into Sochi, other places become easy targets. You don't need to attack the games to make a mess. One bomb in a totally unrelated city is enough to ruin everything.
Same old thing with comrades. Nobody knows anything. The poor people of Russia just can't get a break, can they?
